derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in sense 2; also denoting a section of armour): from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German splinte 'metal plate or pin'; related to splinter

entry.def: A splint is a long piece of wood or metal that is fastened to a broken arm, leg, or back to keep it still.

sentences.sentence: "he lit the fire with a burning splint"

means.word_mean: 2. an orthopedic mechanical device used to immobilize and protect a part of the body (as a broken leg)
